I am a big fan of the horror genre and have had this game since it came out. At first it was very buggy and still is from tie to time but the dev team has made serious improvements and the community is very active for this game. The game can feel repetitive at times but there is a good amount of skill that goes into the chases and looping a killer or winning a chase by outsmarting a survivor as the killer. The most satisfying thing about the game is when you're so focused on getting gens done that you legitimately jump when you don't notice the killer right behind you. For $20 you can't go wrong with this game

the game is **ONLY** fun in costume with friends. Without getting too technical, the matchmaking is severely unbalanced, the game strong arms you into spending $30 or (and i have done the math) OVER A YEAR to get the perks from the shrine which you have to get with points from leveling up, and to my knowledge it's system is exponential. 
The game needs to pay for licenses which i understand, and the way they did that was a painful way that makes anyone who doesn't pay or get lucky with the shrine at a SEVERE disadvantage and makes some characters that are hard to play but fun with perks, utterly painful
